title: New York Times Cooking
text: Welcome vignette NewYorkTimesCooking package using recipes New York Times Cooking. package aims provide recommendations recipes based ingredients handy. food lover, awesome!! come across amazing resource finding new exciting recipes try. vast collection recipes, cooking tips, instructional videos, New York Cooking website become go-many food enthusiasts. package offers FREE. using data extracted New York Times Cooking website, users can save time effort searching online recipes match preferences. user input ingredients , personalize recommended recipes match preferences, making easier find recipes enjoy. personalized approach recommending recipes can also help users explore new recipe making cooking easier .

title: New York Times Cooking
text: NYTrecipe dataset package extracted New York Times Cooking. contains 9,099 NYTCooking recipes 9 aspects recipes. Example snapshot dataset (note. columns included)

title: New York Times Cooking
text: find recipes, user can start calling get_ingredients() function: user prompted enter ingredient 1 text: Enter ingredient 1:. user inputs ingredient found recipes data set, egg EGG (input case sensitive) program print confirmation message: egg found list ingredients. ingredient also stored vector. user inputs ingredient found recipes data set, message notifying user printed: sneaker found list ingredients. failed input stored list ingredients. Additionally, program also check spelling words similar potential ingredient. example, user inputs sugarr instead “sugar”, program catch spelling error print message: sugarr correct. Please check spelling. , failed input stored list ingredients. user can choose input another ingredient responding Y like enter ingredient? (Y/N) . user can input unlimited number ingredients. user satisfied inputted ingredients, user inputs N prompt like enter ingredient (Y/N) program print list ingredients user successfully inputted. example, user inputted egg, sugar, milk, message : entered: egg, sugar, milk program can use inputted ingredients search recipes ingredients, sort based number user reviews New York Times Cooking website, recommend top 10 recipes user.
